data.headline: S&P 500 fell approximately 1.1%, Dow dropped 1.0%, Nasdaq slid 1.5%, and Russell 2000 lost 1.9% amid broad market weakness
bullets: Cisco shares declined after disappointing earnings and a cautious AI-margin outlook, fueling doubts about AI profitability
Megacap AI and tech names, including Nvidia, Intel, Netflix, Palantir, and Shopify, saw sharp declines
Apple plunged 4.2%, with Amazon and Meta also trading lower as Big Tech faced heavy selling pressure
Traders rotated out of AI and tech stocks into value and cyclical sectors
Volatility spiked as concerns over an AI 'minefield' triggered risk-off sentiment
January existing home sales posted their largest monthly drop in nearly four years, deepening housing sector concerns
Stronger-than-expected jobless claims failed to offset negative sentiment from weak housing data
Fading hopes for imminent Fed rate cuts and a reality check on AI hype weighed on market sentiment
Traders are closely watching ongoing earnings reports and the upcoming CPI release for further direction
